author: cbs8
title: Happy Hauntings Brings Friendly, Family Fun to Dutch Wonderland this Weekend in Lancaster, PA
text:
Enjoy Halloween-themed fun that’s ideal for families at Happy Hauntings at Dutch Wonderland, October 17-18, 24-25, 31 and November 1. Happy Hauntings features more than 30 themed rides and attractions, including the “Scar -Go-Round,” the “Roller Ghoster,” and the “Witchie Whip.”
Lancaster, PA (PRWEB) October 16, 2015
Enjoy Halloween-themed fun that’s ideal for families at Happy Hauntings at Dutch Wonderland, October 17-18, 24-25, 31 and November 1. Happy Hauntings features more than 30 themed rides and attractions, including the “Scar -Go-Round,” the “Roller Ghoster,” and the “Witchie Whip.” A trip to Happy Hauntings wouldn’t be complete without seasonal treats, including s’mores roasted around a fire and pumpkin funnel cakes.
Returning this year, “Trick-or-Treat Trail” will be located on the pathways of Exploration Island. Guests 12 and under can trick-or-treat with over 20 lifelike dinosaurs as they make their way through 10 stops along the trail for candy and other surprises. Special trick-or-treat bags will be available at the beginning of the trail courtesy of AAA Central Penn.
New for 2015, Dutch Wonderland unveils Merlin the Great, a live show starring the kingdom’s very own Merlin the Magician. Featuring music, dance and illusions, this Halloween-themed show is included with park admission.
Happy Hauntings is open Saturdays from 2 pm to 9 pm and Sundays from 2 pm to 8pm, October 17-18, October 24-25, October 31 and November 1. Admission is $23.99 per person ages three and up (subject to amusement tax).
For more information about Dutch Wonderland Family Entertainment Complex and its related attractions, please call 1-866-FUNatDW or visit DutchWonderland.com.
About Dutch Wonderland:
Dutch Wonderland is part of the Palace Entertainment family of parks. Palace Entertainment is one of the leading leisure park operators in the United States. With parks located in 10 states, Palace Entertainment continues its expansion of brands within the family entertainment sector. The company operates Kennywood amusement park in Pennsylvania, Noah’s Ark water park in Wisconsin, Splish Splash water park in New York, and Raging Waters in California, among many other family favorite destinations. Palace Entertainment parks provide family oriented and affordable attractions to visitors of all ages, offering a wide range of attractions, such as roller coasters, Ferris wheels, live shows, variable depth pools, water slides, animal shows, miniature golf courses and arcade games. Palace Entertainment greets over 13 million visitors annually.
